item.description:
THIS IS NOT A GWH SPONSORED EVENT.  VISIT THIS LINK FOR MORE INFORMATION

American Humanist Association conference in Cambridge from April 7 to 10. Richard Dawkins, Steven Pinker, Rebecca Goldstein, Steve Wozniak, and many, many others will be there. It will be a great time, and the AHA conference doesn't stop in Boston very often, so please plan on being part of this big event!

Saturday, April 9th
Registration (Main Lobby) 8:00am-8:00pm

Meet and greet for new members

8:00am-9:00am Exhibitors and EvolveFish Humanist Bookstore (Main Lobby) 9:00am-10:00pm

Events

  • The State of Humanism
  • Secular Student Alliance Workshop: Leadership in the Secular Community - Darrel Ray
9:00am-10:15am

Morning Breakout sessions

  • The Future of Humanism: Humanist Chaplaincies and Leadership on Campus - Barry Klassel, Greg Epstein, Anne Klaeyson, Jason Torpy
  • No More War: the Human Potential for Peace - Judith Hand
  • Grassroots Basics: Growing Your Group, Leadership Transitions and Fundraising - Lyz Liddell, August Brunsman, Sharon Moss
10:30am-11:45am

Humanist Awards Luncheon

  • Candace Gingrich-Jones, LGBT Humanist Pride Award 
  • Judy Norsigian, Humanist Heroine
12:00pm-2:45pm

Afternoon Breakout Sessions

  • Health and Sexuality in Our 50s and Beyond - Judy Norsigian
  • To be announced - Barbara Vacarr 
  • Taking it to the Next Level - Jesse Galef, J. T. Eberhard, Cecil Bothwell
3:00pm-4:15pm

Breakout sessions

  • My Church/State Road Trip (or what I learned from my visit to the Creation Museum) - Jay Wexler
  • Building Diversity: Women, Minorities and LGBT in Local Groups - Jen McCreight, Debbie Goddard, Greta Christina
  • Unintelligent Design - Abby Hafer
4:30pm-5:45pm Humanist Contributors Reception
RSVP required
6:00pm-7:00pm

Humanist of the Year Banquet

  • Roy Zimmerman, Entertainment
  • Steve Wozniak, Isaac Asimov Science Award
7:00pm-9:30pm
item.how_to_find_us: We'll be all over the place, but we'll most likely have our GWH nametags...
item.name: 70th Anniversary Conference of the American Humanist Association
